data.title: Best coffee in Philly
data.text: La Colombe is a favorite spot to meet an great and f course enjoy very good coffee. The have an original coffees from all around the world and I know that they are brewing it themselves in Port Richmond warehouse.The espresso is the best there. They also have some good pastries to accompany your coffee. In there Fishtown location the serve very good lunch and dinner

data.title: Excellent place for breakfast
data.text:
Their croissants, brioches, pains au chocolat, are as good as in France. Often crowded it can be a little bit noisy.
Coffee is freshly moulded it seems on the spot

data.title: THIS PLACE IS A MUST FOR COFFEE ADDICTS
data.text: Great fast service, great coffee. Pastries I haven't tried but I will safely assume that they fit right in with all the other great stuff. Well priced, won't break the bank. Very cozy ambiance for reading or working. Pretty cups and matching furniture.

data.title: Excellent Coffe Cafe and Bakery...with a Conscience
data.text:
La Colombe has a truly distinguished range of superb coffees...and their Downtown, rustic location has excellent breads,bakery items and is a "must see" ( as is the general area...!)...
An especially appealing aspect is that the founders go out of their way worldwide to find the very best product and support local growers who meet their high standards and merit support and investment.

data.title: The Worst Bitter, Burned Robusta Coffee
data.text: La Colombe is a small coffee shop near Rittenhouse Square.  Unfortunately, it serves the worst bitter, burned Robusta coffee you can buy.  It is like Starbucks coffee, perhaps even more bitter and more burned.  The idea that this is "premium" coffee, or good coffee, is a joke.  Stay away from this place if you are looking for a good cup of medium roasted Arabica (good quality) coffee

data.title: Quick coffee that is delicius
data.text: In the hub of center city, great coffee and fast paced, but homey location, yummy coffee and pastries

data.title: Be careful with sugar at La Colombe counter at Reading Terminal Market
data.text: La Colombe's coffee is excellent.  This is not about the coffee.  This is gross:   At the La Colombe counter at the Reading Terminal Market in Philadelphia -- the counter where they sell the fancy cakes and European-style desserts and pastries -- when you order coffee, if you use real sugar it is not offered in packets.  Everyone must place their fingertip on the opening to the sugar dispenser in order to hold it open and pour coffee into the cup.  Clearly everyone does this and it is absolutely disgusting and very unhygienic.  Since they offer packets of Splenda, I do not understand why they don't offer packets of regular sugar.   Be careful, lots of germs here if you use sugar with your coffee!

data.title: YUM!
data.text: Best coffee, Corsica is our favorite...smooth, mellow, tastes the way coffee smells when you go down the coffee aisle elsewhere where coffeee not even as good as here, but still smells great. Great service here, coffee go with pastries are scrumptious! Relaxing place.

data.title: Great Coffee and Service
data.text: This is a great spot to get a good, reasonably priced cup of coffee.  At times the lines are long and I wish they had more space to accommodate the longer lines but the service makes up for it.  We will continue to go back and patronage.

data.title: Simply the best
data.text: This is hands-down the best coffee in the city. This location is comfortable and clean;  servers are attentive and nice.

data.title: Philadelphia's version of Starbucks
data.text:
This location is right across from City Hall.  It has dependably good fair trade coffees, lattes, etc. with a limited selection of pastry, etc.
Some of the seating is tree stumps and slabs of wood tables, so don't expect cushy comfort.  In good weather, we usually get our coffee and go sit across the street at Dilworth Park to people watch or in the winter, watch the ice skating.

data.title: Always good
data.text:
You an never go wrong with coffee from here. Never. 
La Colombe is the Philly Coffee.  

One thing is for sure, Good Coffee does not need cream and sugar. There is nothing needed to add to it to make it great. It already is.

data.title: Fantastic coffee, great place to hang out with friends
data.text: The La Colombe here is a great place to go if you want to have good coffee, catch up with friends or just read a book or write! It gets a bit noisy in the afternoon and evening, so not an ideal place for you to sit for hours and get intense work done.

data.title: Coffee sent from heaven!
data.text: I'm not putting down any other large coffee shop, but they simply pale in comparison to La Colombe coffee.  You can tell that this is a quality cup of coffee that you will thoroughly enjoy.  Don't miss out, and their coffee is served at different locations in Philly.

data.title: Nice, cozy place
data.text: Forget the chains selling coffee or tea, if you're in the center of Phili and want more than just a warm coffee or some tea find La Colombe. Excellent variety of tea and coffee, made properly. The scone was pretty nice we well.

data.title: Creativity and coffee are in the air!
data.text: If you are looking for a great authentic and cozy coffee shop, this is it. Whether you just want to people watch or find your creative voice, La Colombe is the spot. Time and care are put into every coffee and pastry.

data.title: Nice little hide away for a quick coffee.
data.text:
La Colombe is a nice little hide away to grab a quick coffee and rest feet. Not as busy or as commercial as a main Street coffee shop.

Not a massive amount of seating and was  busy today. 

One word replies from staff, not much customer service interaction but otherwise good presentation.

data.title: best coffee in Philly
data.text: If you have never been to La Colombe, you are missing out. Its the best coffee in Philadelphia. Get a croissant while you are at it and sit down for a bit, enjoy people watching as the cool, the hip, the artists and the intellectuals all hang out at La Colombe.

data.title: Such a treasure!
data.text: This place takes coffee houses to a whole nutha' level!! Wow! I've had great coffee around the world, but this is one of my faves! Such perfectly elegant ladies behind the counter helped make the whole experience amazing! Very unique furniture around the place made it feel like a cafe from another country. Definitely a place to revisit next time I am in Philly!

data.title: Superb Coffee with a Social Conscience
data.text: The coffees and blends at La Colombe are consistently superb...and the founders' support of global social values is an added plus!  The Rittenhouse Square location has a distinctive European feel...and the Fishtown site is very cool!
